trans-unit.source: SQL Database User Error Recovery
trans-unit.target: SQL Database User Error Recovery

trans-unit.source: Learn how to recover from user error, accidental data corruption, or a deleted database using the Point-in-time Restore (PITR) feature of Azure SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to recover from user error, accidental data corruption, or a deleted database using the Point-in-time Restore (PITR) feature of Azure SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: Recover an Azure SQL Database from a user error
trans-unit.target: Recover an Azure SQL Database from a user error

trans-unit.source: Azure SQL Database offers two core capabilities for recovering from user error or unintended data modification.
trans-unit.target: Azure SQL Database offers two core capabilities for recovering from user error or unintended data modification.

trans-unit.source: Point In Time Restore
trans-unit.target: Point In Time Restore

trans-unit.source: Restore deleted database
trans-unit.target: Restore deleted database

trans-unit.source: You can learn more about these capabilities on this [blog post](http://azure.microsoft.com/blog/2014/10/01/azure-sql-database-point-in-time-restore/).
trans-unit.target: You can learn more about these capabilities on this [blog post](http://azure.microsoft.com/blog/2014/10/01/azure-sql-database-point-in-time-restore/).

trans-unit.source: Azure SQL Database always restores to a new database.
trans-unit.target: Azure SQL Database always restores to a new database.

trans-unit.source: These restore capabilities are offered to all Basic, Standard, and Premium databases.
trans-unit.target: These restore capabilities are offered to all Basic, Standard, and Premium databases.

trans-unit.source: Recovery with Point In Time Restore
trans-unit.target: Recovery with Point In Time Restore

trans-unit.source: In the event of a user error or unintended data modification, Point In Time Restore can be used to restore your database to any point in time within your databases retention period.
trans-unit.target: In the event of a user error or unintended data modification, Point In Time Restore can be used to restore your database to any point in time within your databases retention period.

trans-unit.source: Basic databases have 7 days of retention, Standard databases have 14 days of retention, and Premium databases have 35 days of retention.
trans-unit.target: Basic databases have 7 days of retention, Standard databases have 14 days of retention, and Premium databases have 35 days of retention.

trans-unit.source: To learn more about database retention please read our [business continuity overview](sql-database-business-continuity.md).
trans-unit.target: To learn more about database retention please read our [business continuity overview](sql-database-business-continuity.md).

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Restoring a database creates a new database.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Restoring a database creates a new database.

trans-unit.source: It is important to make sure the server you are restoring to has enough DTU capacity for the new database.
trans-unit.target: It is important to make sure the server you are restoring to has enough DTU capacity for the new database.

trans-unit.source: You can request an increase of this quota by [contacting support](http://azure.microsoft.com/blog/azure-limits-quotas-increase-requests/).
trans-unit.target: You can request an increase of this quota by [contacting support](http://azure.microsoft.com/blog/azure-limits-quotas-increase-requests/).

trans-unit.source: Azure Portal
trans-unit.target: Azure Portal

trans-unit.source: Log in to the [Azure Portal](https://portal.Azure.com)
trans-unit.target: Log in to the [Azure Portal](https://portal.Azure.com)

trans-unit.source: On the left side of the screen select **BROWSE** and then select **SQL Databases**.
trans-unit.target: On the left side of the screen select **BROWSE** and then select **SQL Databases**.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to your database and select it.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to your database and select it.

trans-unit.source: At the top of your database's blade, select **Restore**.
trans-unit.target: At the top of your database's blade, select **Restore**.

trans-unit.source: Specify a database name, point in time and then click **Create**.
trans-unit.target: Specify a database name, point in time and then click **Create**.

trans-unit.source: The database restore process will begin and can be monitored using **NOTIFICATIONS** on the left side of the screen.
trans-unit.target: The database restore process will begin and can be monitored using **NOTIFICATIONS** on the left side of the screen.

trans-unit.source: After the restore has completed, you can configure your recovered database to be used by following the [Finalize a Recovered Database](sql-database-recovered-finalize.md) guide.
trans-unit.target: After the restore has completed, you can configure your recovered database to be used by following the [Finalize a Recovered Database](sql-database-recovered-finalize.md) guide.

trans-unit.source: PowerShell
trans-unit.target: PowerShell

trans-unit.source: Use PowerShell to programmatically perform database restore.
trans-unit.target: Use PowerShell to programmatically perform database restore.

trans-unit.source: To restore a database with Point In Time Restore, use the [Start-AzureSqlDatabaseRestore](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn720218.aspx?f=255&MSPPError=-2147217396) cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: To restore a database with Point In Time Restore, use the [Start-AzureSqlDatabaseRestore](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn720218.aspx?f=255&MSPPError=-2147217396) cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: For a detailed walk through, please see our [how-to video](http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/restore-a-sql-database-using-point-in-time-restore-with-microsoft-azure-powershell/).
trans-unit.target: For a detailed walk through, please see our [how-to video](http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/restore-a-sql-database-using-point-in-time-restore-with-microsoft-azure-powershell/).

trans-unit.source: After the restore has completed, you can configure your recovered database to be used by following the [Finalize a Recovered Database](sql-database-recovered-finalize.md) guide.
trans-unit.target: After the restore has completed, you can configure your recovered database to be used by following the [Finalize a Recovered Database](sql-database-recovered-finalize.md) guide.

trans-unit.source: REST API
trans-unit.target: REST API

trans-unit.source: Use REST to programmatically perform database restore.
trans-unit.target: Use REST to programmatically perform database restore.

trans-unit.source: Get the database you want to restore using the [Get Database](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn505708.aspx) operation.
trans-unit.target: Get the database you want to restore using the [Get Database](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn505708.aspx) operation.

trans-unit.source: Create the restore request using the [Create Database Restore Request](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn509571.aspx) operation.
trans-unit.target: Create the restore request using the [Create Database Restore Request](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn509571.aspx) operation.

trans-unit.source: Track the restore request using the [Database Operation Status](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn720371.aspx) operation.
trans-unit.target: Track the restore request using the [Database Operation Status](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn720371.aspx) operation.

trans-unit.source: After the restore has completed, you can configure your recovered database to be used by following the [Finalize a Recovered Database](sql-database-recovered-finalize.md) guide.
trans-unit.target: After the restore has completed, you can configure your recovered database to be used by following the [Finalize a Recovered Database](sql-database-recovered-finalize.md) guide.

trans-unit.source: Recover a deleted database
trans-unit.target: Recover a deleted database

trans-unit.source: In the event a database is deleted, Azure SQL Database allows you to restore the deleted database to the point in time of deletion.
trans-unit.target: In the event a database is deleted, Azure SQL Database allows you to restore the deleted database to the point in time of deletion.

trans-unit.source: Azure SQL Database stores the deleted database backup for the retention period of the database.
trans-unit.target: Azure SQL Database stores the deleted database backup for the retention period of the database.

trans-unit.source: The retention period of a deleted database is determined by the service tier of the database while it existed or the number of days where the database exists, whichever is less.
trans-unit.target: The retention period of a deleted database is determined by the service tier of the database while it existed or the number of days where the database exists, whichever is less.

trans-unit.source: To learn more about database retention read our [business continuity overview](sql-database-business-continuity.md).
trans-unit.target: To learn more about database retention read our [business continuity overview](sql-database-business-continuity.md).

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Restoring a database creates a new database.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Restoring a database creates a new database.

trans-unit.source: It is important to make sure the server you are restoring to has enough DTU capacity for the new database.
trans-unit.target: It is important to make sure the server you are restoring to has enough DTU capacity for the new database.

trans-unit.source: You can request an increase of this quota by [contacting support](http://azure.microsoft.com/blog/azure-limits-quotas-increase-requests/).
trans-unit.target: You can request an increase of this quota by [contacting support](http://azure.microsoft.com/blog/azure-limits-quotas-increase-requests/).

trans-unit.source: Azure Portal
trans-unit.target: Azure Portal

trans-unit.source: Log in to the [Azure Portal](https://portal.Azure.com)
trans-unit.target: Log in to the [Azure Portal](https://portal.Azure.com)

trans-unit.source: On the left side of the screen select **BROWSE** and then select **SQL Servers**.
trans-unit.target: On the left side of the screen select **BROWSE** and then select **SQL Servers**.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to your sever and select it.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to your sever and select it.

trans-unit.source: Under **Operations** on you server's blade, select **Deleted Databases**.
trans-unit.target: Under **Operations** on you server's blade, select **Deleted Databases**.

trans-unit.source: Select the deleted database you want to restore.
trans-unit.target: Select the deleted database you want to restore.

trans-unit.source: Specify a database name and click **Create**.
trans-unit.target: Specify a database name and click **Create**.

trans-unit.source: The database restore process will begin and can be monitored using **NOTIFICATIONS** on the left side of the screen.
trans-unit.target: The database restore process will begin and can be monitored using **NOTIFICATIONS** on the left side of the screen.

trans-unit.source: After the restore has completed, you can configure your recovered database to be used by following the [Finalize a Recovered Database](sql-database-recovered-finalize.md) guide.
trans-unit.target: After the restore has completed, you can configure your recovered database to be used by following the [Finalize a Recovered Database](sql-database-recovered-finalize.md) guide.

trans-unit.source: PowerShell
trans-unit.target: PowerShell

trans-unit.source: Use PowerShell to programmatically perform database restore.
trans-unit.target: Use PowerShell to programmatically perform database restore.

trans-unit.source: To restore a deleted database, use the [Start-AzureSqlDatabaseRestore](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn720218.aspx?f=255&MSPPError=-2147217396) cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: To restore a deleted database, use the [Start-AzureSqlDatabaseRestore](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn720218.aspx?f=255&MSPPError=-2147217396) cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: For a detailed walk through, please see our [how-to video](http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/restore-a-deleted-sql-database-with-microsoft-azure-powershell/).
trans-unit.target: For a detailed walk through, please see our [how-to video](http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/restore-a-deleted-sql-database-with-microsoft-azure-powershell/).

trans-unit.source: Find the deleted database and its deletion date from the list of deleted databases.
trans-unit.target: Find the deleted database and its deletion date from the list of deleted databases.

trans-unit.source: Get the specific deleted database and start the restore.
trans-unit.target: Get the specific deleted database and start the restore.

trans-unit.source: After the restore has completed, you can configure your recovered database to be used by following the [Finalize a Recovered Database](sql-database-recovered-finalize.md) guide.
trans-unit.target: After the restore has completed, you can configure your recovered database to be used by following the [Finalize a Recovered Database](sql-database-recovered-finalize.md) guide.

trans-unit.source: REST API
trans-unit.target: REST API

trans-unit.source: Use REST to programmatically perform database restore.
trans-unit.target: Use REST to programmatically perform database restore.

trans-unit.source: List all of your restorable deleted databases by using the [List Restorable Dropped Databases](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn509562.aspx) operation.
trans-unit.target: List all of your restorable deleted databases by using the [List Restorable Dropped Databases](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn509562.aspx) operation.

trans-unit.source: Get the details for the deleted database you want to restore by using the [Get Restorable Dropped Database](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn509574.aspx) operation.
trans-unit.target: Get the details for the deleted database you want to restore by using the [Get Restorable Dropped Database](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn509574.aspx) operation.

trans-unit.source: Begin your restore by using the [Create Database Restore Request](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn509571.aspx) operation.
trans-unit.target: Begin your restore by using the [Create Database Restore Request](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn509571.aspx) operation.

trans-unit.source: Track the status of your restore by using the [Database Operation Status](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn720371.aspx) operation.
trans-unit.target: Track the status of your restore by using the [Database Operation Status](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn720371.aspx) operation.

trans-unit.source: After the restore has completed, you can configure your recovered database to be used by following the [Finalize a Recovered Database](sql-database-recovered-finalize.md) guide.
trans-unit.target: After the restore has completed, you can configure your recovered database to be used by following the [Finalize a Recovered Database](sql-database-recovered-finalize.md) guide.
